Ecology.Habitats:
Bees were known to inhabit the [[Moonshae Isles]], the [[Dalelands]],, the [[Farsea Marshes]], [[Katakoro]], and the [[plane]] of [[Arcadia]].

In the [[Savage Frontier]] region they could be found in [[Laughing Hollow]].
Ecology.Relationships: Bees were a [[favored animal]] of the [[halfling]] goddess [[Sheela Peryroyl]].{{Cite web enhancement/Deity Do's and Don'ts|14}}
Ecology.Usage:
[[File:Neverwinter - Beehive chunk.png|thumb|250px|''A chunk of honeycomb from a beehive.'']]
Beekeeping, a practice of keeping and tending to domesticated bees in return for the products they made, mainly [[honey]],{{Cite web/theedverse/2021-02-13 - Beekeeping and Wax in the Realms}} was very common throughout the Realms, wherever the climate allowed. This practice often involved a tool known as a [[beehive]], an artificial structure for bees to live in.

Some notable places where beekeeping was practiced included the town of [[Eveningstar]], the city-state of [[Neverwinter]], and the plane of [[Dothion]],

Other products of bees that other creatures harvested included [[beeswax]] and a resin mixture known as [[propolis]], which among other things could be used to make a varnish.

The [[spell]] ''[[shrieking walls]]'' required the wing of a bee as a [[material component]]. Bee wings were known to be sold in pairs of six in [[Aurora's Whole Realms Catalogue|''Aurora's Whole Realms Catalogue'']]'' ''at a price of 3 [[cp]].

document_data.Rumors & Legends: One legend in the [[Feywild]] claimed that the secret of making honey was sold to the bee species as a whole by [[pixie]]s, who had stolen it from a goblet of [[mead]] belonging to the [[Summer Queen]].
document_data.Trivia:
* Due to being natural pollinators, bees were often associated with the goddess [[Chauntea]]. An image of bees could be found embossed on the door-ring of many Chauntean temples.<ref>{{Cite web/theedverse/2020-05-11 - Chauntea & Bees}}
* [[Bisan]] were occasionally known to ''[[polymorph self]]'' into honey bees.
